performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: The best Dancin'
Funkalicous, jazz juiced '77ness, Fourteen and a half minutes ewwwey, gooooey, boggie
Another great tune from the legendary Harpur College show. Includes a really great tighten up jam.

performances.venue: Cape Cod Coliseum South Yarmouth, MA
performances.description: Funky

performances.venue: Springfield Civic Center Arena Springfield, MA
performances.description: All around nuts
Classic
Favorite '77 Dancin'. Jamming gets real cruchy!!!

performances.venue: St. Louis Arena St. Louis, MO
performances.description: Big, romping version.  Get loose
Funky all over the place, excellent transition to Wharf Rat and then back again
Crazy early version
Jazzy
Huge Dancin -> Wharf Rat -> Dancin sandwich.  Awesome.
Super dancin' into an absolutely amazing Cosmic Charlie.  One of my all time favorites!

performances.venue: Lloyd Noble Center - University of Oklahoma Norman, OK
performances.description: Jerry is absolutely posessed in this version.  Wow does not sum it up enough!
Awesome transition into Franklin's.  Cape Cod version is better known, but this is just as hot.
How is this not on here?  All you really have to say is 2/14/70, but with that being said...this one is epic.
Fallout from the Phil Zone. Unique, one of the finest early versions.

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center Arena St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Scarlet->Fire->Dancin In the Streets wow what a straight up jam fest boogie down dead.
Excellent early version. The jam in the middle is a fine bit of acid rock.
Probably some of the funkiest Phil I've ever heard
peak version of the "true" dancin' - there's a very good AUD
Slow, relentless jam--unique and very cool version from an unheralded show.
Out there and way jammy
While not the definitive version, that would come four days later, this is a rollicking romper full of 19 minutes of Dead Funk.
outta nowhere "Got my Mojo Workin" sandwiched in between
Great Dancin' out of Eyes...the intro jam is the highlight of this one.
Great interplay between Bobby and Jerry. Well jammed out and then the Jerry / Billy solo jam at the end is fabulous.  Surprised it is not on the list.
into a very mellow cosmic charlie
Wonderful funk fest comes out of a not 1977 Eyes of the world, the band was just such jam masters at this time. AMAZING
You know in the first drum beats you are in for a serious treat.  Cannot beat 76' Dancin' versions :)
HUGE early Dancin', possibly the best ever--they are just totally dialed into one another like fingers of a hand!
2nd to Greek'84 for '80s fallback versions to me.  Jerry's solo just does it.
'76 is always funky but this evening seems to have an extra layer of the FUNK, Help->Slip->Franklin's->Dancin how did they have so much energy 40 min.
Dancin' > NFA > Dancin' sandy.  Pretty hot stuff
Jerry has laryngitis, so he speaks with his hands.  Starts as a buttsweat dancefest.  Long jam that eventually quiets to a whisper before wrapping up
Clean Version
Nice long jamming early version, Jerry rips his solos on this one real hot
Jamming monster in Honolulu Hawaii. TREMENDOUS
Huge and Fluid, 15+ min
Hot combo of Scarlet Begonias into Dancin in in The Streets, Very cool transition between the two songs, loaded with Jerry noodles.
gotta check out this pre-mickey version.  Awesome
Another knock-out 1970 version.
How is this not here.  Epic Dancin>CRS!
whole show smokes
Funky as they get, this entire second set is as groovy as they come.  What a treat!
Ridiculous
Wow Dancin->Eyes a dream come true.  How is this not up here. figured a powerhouse 1977 performance had to be here.
cool version

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Opens show, segues into Bird Song. Couldn't get enough of this pairing (or the show) for  a while. Smokin
Jerry jamming in the middle of the song is absolutely amazing...
Let it Grow->Dancin-> Cosmic Charlie is very meaty and heady stuff, Funky as all hell, great disco funk jam.
Funky funky funky Dancin scorching Jerry leads Pil bombs away, great discofied jam fest
Scarlet fire Dancin what a run a pure jammy thon at Red Rocks Jerry really enjoying it
Jerry's on fire in this show opener.  Not my favorite song, but just a rippin' version here.  Wish I could have been there....

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
Kiel Opera House St. Louis, MO
performances.description: Fantastic long jammy opener
Always such a great exploration vehicle in the 60's.

performances.venue: Onondaga County War Memorial Syracuse, NY
performances.description: How on earth is this not up yet?  It really kicks off the Fall '76 retooling of Dancin' with style. Brilliant, tight, and part of an enormous 2nd set.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: its dissolves into a hugh Dark Star jam, before returning to Dancin'
Churns, plays itself out, factor playing. Energetic, smooth as smooth.
typically hot late 1970's version funky leads into an intense drums
Another fabulous and funky 1976 Dancin' Super disco funk on this one, Hot
Another Funk storm from 1976 comes bopping beautifully out of a funky Eyes of the World. Great stuff killer combo listen up and enjoy

performances.venue: Cassell Coliseum - Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University Blacksburg, VA
performances.description: Dancin In the Streets->Drums->Space->The Other One Mad awesome 1978 headiness, Nice Donna and Bobby

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Easily the best Dancin' ever. So mellow and trippy and spacey, almost Dark-Starry. Officially released from the Family Dog via the Download series
Dancin' on the beach!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

performances.venue: Kansas City Municipal Auditorium Arena Kansas City, MO
performances.description: Minglewood>Bertha>Dancin..............1st one in years "sweet"
Hello? This is some of Jerry's best playing of the era. Brief but inspired.

performances.venue: Field House, U. of Cincinnati Cincinnati, OH
performances.description: Churning and meandering, flowing tightening up and raveling back

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: A lost masterpiece, now restored on the new Dave's Picks! The once-missing jam is a face-stealer.
Early classic dead

performances.venue: Soldiers' and Sailors' Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: Dancin'>Franklins>LLRain>Deal to close 1st set!!! "Heaven on Earth"
Filler from the Family Dog download series
Fastest version I’ve ever heard. Bobby: “what Motor City?” quip mid-song.
Last one!  Also, haven't done Dancin'>Franklins since those great version of 79!
Hot version Jerry just ripping away
Dancin->Drums->The Other One is truly a great sequence for the Bobby fans out there. Really cool interesting stuff.
They really let loose on this one. Funky and Massive, Top 5 for the year.
Played almost everynight of the tour but still maintains a funky fresh disco dead flavor.
another heady funky dancing, great donna on this one, June of 76 Bobby plays almost same songs nightly butthey sound inspired and fresh,amazing feat.
Great early cover of the soul classic. It is amazing how many changes this song went through over the many times they played it Garage band style here
Very well jammed my favorite of the post disco versions of the song
Another GREAT jammed to all hell 1970 version Jerry just rips this to shreds.

performances.venue: Community War Memorial Auditorium Rochester, NY
performances.description: usually let the tune speak 4 itself but his kicks some butt, great post disco/funk version.
Brent's first Dancin, nice Funky Disco version, Nice Jam loads of note bending Funkiness.
Rare encore position
A nice surprise for '85. Jer's vox is shot but the playing is sweetness.
One of the finer versions of the year

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: What a goofy pre-drums...love the Dancin' right into BMR.
Meaty and funky but the real star of this version may be the amazing jam from Dancin into Wharf Rat some killer stuff and the crowd goes crazy!

performances.venue: Onongada County War Memorial Syracuse, NY
performances.description: Playful punchy funk another great funkathon from 1978 dead, The funk dead is awesome

performances.venue: Cameron Indoor Stadium, Duke U Durham, NC
performances.description: PHIL PHIL and moe PHIL with some ample help from Mr. Garcia, sung powerfully by Donna and Bobby a great 12+ minute version.
Jammed out more than most songs from this show.
On of the post-haitus ones that stretch and groove and go every-which-way.  What a treat.
Gets pretty spacey, sounds like they hint at Tighten Up a little...
"C'mon everybody get in a big long line and dance around now!" Absolutely primal Dead
Firey pumping funk leads into drums  which flows into a nice smoking franklin's
Hot Dancin->Deal to end set one.
Part of a spectacular Dancin->Terrapin->Playin->Drumz->Ollin Arrageed Jam Sequence Really a great show
another exploratory jammy improvisational Dancin from 1976. Great funky jam.
Questionable date, but unquestionably amazing. A great classic jam with a near-perfect recording for the time.  A++
How has this whole show been overlooked?  I know '76 is generally undervalued, even by '70s fans, but c'mon, this is smokin' hot stuff.

performances.venue: Pan Handle Golden Gate Park San Francisco, CA
performances.description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VNPzRoL_1DU
This one is hot!!
Kick-ass playing! Sound is a little distorted, but no matter
Dead at the Shed and a revved up show opener of Dancin' makes for a killer show
A case could be made for this being the finest version ever.
Rare, rough, and out of Dark Star

performances.venue: SIU Arena, University Of Souther Illinois Carbondale, IL
performances.description: Read The book by Steve Parrish to hear the story of Jerry taking 4 valiums before going on stage sluggish for set one but he got fired up for set 2
Criminally underrated show summer 69 was an amazing time for the boys
Show opener in Bezerkley
Superb version, surprising not listed yet.  Tighter to my ears than the other more well-known ones in the Boston run. Check it out!

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI

performances.description: fantastic studio outtake not burdened with all the technical bs added to the released album
Hot early version from a hot show all around

performances.venue: Saratoga Performing Arts Center Saratoga Springs, NY
performances.description: Dancin returns with a new more rocking less funk but still jamming form.
God this one is crazy the singing is insane like what the fuck and then the cut. Where it picks back up is again what the fuck! I don't know try it
Epic wanderings from the “Woodacre Training Camp”

performances.venue: Club Front Studio San Rafael, CA
performances.description: Very cool studio rehearsals with new grooves and wildly flanged sound. Fall '76 versions are some of the best, and here they are still in the egg.
High-velocity, high-power jamming magic, all packed into less than nine minutes. Intense. From a wonderful overlooked show.
Cuts out in the out-chorus, but shows the initial move from cover band into exploratory jams and bendy form.  Very cool testament to where they were.

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Coming out of Scarlet Begonias, has a bit more of a '76 vibe than most of 77-78
What a party! Need more Pig vox
